definition: True gold fears no fire. (idiom)
pinyin: zhen1 jin1 bu4 pa4 huo3 lian4

definition: really/truly/indeed/real/true/genuine
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
(negative prefix)/not/no
surname Pa
to be afraid/to fear/to dread/to be unable to endure/perhaps
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo
variant of 鏈|链[lian4], chain/variant of 煉|炼[lian4]
to refine/to smelt

sentences.english: The fire is the test of gold, adversity of strong man.
sentences.chinese: 真金不怕火炼，灾难能使人强壮。

sentences.english: The sincerity of a friendship is tested by some dangers, as gold is by fire.
sentences.chinese: 友谊忠诚不怕危险，十足真金不怕火炼。

sentences.english: Fire is the test of gold; adversity, of strong men.
sentences.chinese: 真金不怕火炼，逆境是强者的试金石。

sentences.english: True gold fears no fire; A person of integrity can stand servere tests.
sentences.chinese: 真金不怕火炼，真英雄不怕遭遇挫折。

definition: just as distance determines the stamina of a horse, so does time reveal a person's true heart (proverb)
pinyin: lu4 yao2 zhi1 ma3 li4 , ri4 jiu3 jian4 ren2 xin1
related.word: 路遥知马力，日久见人心

definition: facts speak louder than words (idiom)
pinyin: shi4 shi2 sheng4 yu2 xiong2 bian4

definition: to be tempered into a steel
the storm put strong grass to the test (idiom); fig. troubled times test a faithful minister/to show one's true colors after a stern test/also written 疾風勁草|疾风劲草
Actual practice is the sole criterion for judging truth (item from Deng Xiaoping theory, from 1978)
pinyin: shi2 jian4 shi4 jian3 yan4 zhen1 li3 de5 wei2 yi1 biao1 zhun3
related.word: 实践是检验真理的唯一标准

definition: after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
mere verbal statement cannot be taken as proof (idiom)
lit. sincerity splits open metal and metal (idiom); if you put your heart to it, you can break up metal and rocks/With a will, you can achieve anything.
pinyin: jing1 cheng2 suo3 zhi4 , jin1 shi2 wei4 kai1

definition: (idiom) you can't rely on a verbal agreement/just because sb says sth, doesn't mean it's true
Take what you hear to be false, only believe it when you see it (idiom). Don't believe what people tell you until you see if for yourself./It ain't necessarily so.
pinyin: er3 ting1 wei2 xu1 , yan3 jian4 wei2 shi2

definition: touchstone/fig. test that sth is genuine
seeing is believing
the meal is remembered long after the wait is forgotten/the good things in life are worth waiting for
lit. public opinion is powerful enough to melt metal (idiom)/fig. public clamor can obscure the actual truth/mass spreading of rumors can confuse right and wrong
true sentiments are seen in hard times (idiom)/you see who your true friends are when you go through tough times together/you see who your true friends are when you are in difficulties
not all gold is sufficiently red (idiom); no-one is perfect
